definition: animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
to reform and open to the outside world/refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980
PRC National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC), formed in 2003
pinyin: Guo2 jia1 Fa1 zhan3 he2 Gai3 ge2 Wei3 yuan2 hui4
containing_words.word: 国家发展和改革委员会

definition: PRC National Development and Reform Commission
pinyin: Guo2 jia1 Fa1 zhan3 Gai3 ge2 Wei3

sentences.english: They rely on police and media pressure to reform such businesses, he added.
sentences.chinese: 他们依靠警方和媒体压力来改革此类营生，他说。

sentences.english: Progress in health care and education reform.
sentences.chinese: 医疗卫生和教育改革的进展。

sentences.english: The theory of constructionism contributes to the psychology teaching.
sentences.chinese: 建构主义理论对于心理学教学改革有着重要的启示。

sentences.english: Politically there were the tax reform and adjustment of the lower administration systems.
sentences.chinese: 政治方面体现在赋役的改革和基层管理体系的调整。

sentences.english: Under the reform banner, I would also include the social dimension.
sentences.chinese: 在改革的框架下，我也想谈一谈社会问题。

sentences.english: We will move forward with reform of the rural land management system in an orderly manner.
sentences.chinese: 有序推进农村土地管理制度改革。

sentences.english: Senior middle school chemistry teaching should be conducted with the concept of new curriculum reform.
sentences.chinese: 高中化学教学需要用新课程改革的理念来统领。

sentences.english: We will accelerate reforms of county and township government institutions.
sentences.chinese: 加快推进县乡机构等配套改革。

sentences.english: Under this background, the reform of non-penalization in china is being put on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 在这一背景下，中国的非刑罚化改革也被提上日程。

sentences.english: Office of National Development and Reform Commission …
sentences.chinese: 改革委资环司郑重声明。

sentences.english: They may look like an ordinary pair of spectacles, but these glasses are at the forefront of a revolution in eyewear.
sentences.chinese: 它们看起来像普通的眼镜，但是是眼镜改革的最前沿。

sentences.english: China's current reform is in this very historical point.
sentences.chinese: 中国目前的改革，正处于这样的历史关头。

sentences.english: It can be said that the reforms of Sheng should be particularly cautious.
sentences.chinese: 可以说，笙在改革方向的选择上尤应慎重。

sentences.english: The second is to reform the tax-refund sharing system.
sentences.chinese: 二是要改革出口退税共同负担机制。

sentences.english: We regard scientific research as the first driving force of the reform and development of education.
sentences.chinese: 学校把教科研工作作为教育改革与发展的第一推动力。

sentences.english: It did not， however， mention any timetable for future reform.
sentences.chinese: 可是，它并未就未来的改革定下时间表。

definition: to put into effect/to carry out
super-ministry system (reform aimed at streamlining government department functions)
new policy/New Deal (Roosevelt's 1933 policy to deal with the Great Depression)
